definition: looting
tumult/uproar/commotion/disturbance
to deceive/to coax/to amuse (a child)
variant of 鬨|哄[hong4]
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch

sentences.english: In the legislation, the organized robbery crime should be further improved.
sentences.chinese: 在立法上，对聚众哄抢罪还应作进一步完善。

sentences.english: One looter was killed when the 2 sides exchanged fire.
sentences.chinese: 双方发生交火，一名哄抢者被击毙。

sentences.english: Police arrived and shot one of the looters, eyewitnesses said.
sentences.chinese: 目击者说，警方到达现场，打死了一名哄抢者。

sentences.english: He has starred in Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet and Joe Orton's Loot.
sentences.chinese: 他主演的哈姆雷特，罗密欧与茱丽叶和乔奥顿的哄抢。
